Description: Body of Attic red-figured pottery oinochoe (neck, rim and handle missing); above figured zone, tongues; below it ovules. Head of Arimasp, to right, between heads of griffins; reserved band at junction of body and foot; glazed black on foot; underside reserved.
Producer name: Attributed to: The Painter of London F18
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1221)
